page.title: 01Introduction to the area
page.content: About half this D-Block comprises the River Severn.The land bordering the Severn has been drained and is now used for animal grazing.While most of the land is low-lying interspersed are areas of higher land which afford marvellous views of the Severn, surrounding countryside and Gwent coastline. Farms are scattered throughout the area and engage in both crop growing and pastoral farming. Two villages, Aust and Littleton-on-Severn occupy the south-west and south-east corners respectively. Aust is dominated by the Severn Road Bridge and the Motorway Service Area at Aust Cliff which contrasts with the tranquility of the main part of the village. Littleton-on-Severn is so quiet it could easily be missed by the uobservant visitor.
